column1: Inner! said grandma. "What does that mean? Some new expression. I have no doubt
column2: which I never before heard; but an old lady of eighty years can't be expected to keep up with the times. It's something dreadful
column3: of course."But what was the old lady's surprise when the boys threw aside their blue jackets
column4: and two of them began to throw the "stone" back and forth
column5: one to the other; while the third boy stood between
column6: striking at it as it flew through the air
column7: and sometimes hitting it and sometimes not. There they staid all the afternoon doing the same thing."Why
column8: said grandma, putting on her glasses, and looking more closely. I declare! they're only playing ball
column10: I'm glad they're not so cruel as I thought them. They are such pretty little boys
column11: and have such pretty red stockings too!""But
column12: said she, after a long pause, there is still one thing that troubles me. Where is the 'old cat'?"
